{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3497640,"name":"Sunny","username":"mentorsiggy","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/9fc348/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T06:32:33.819Z","cooked":"

Hi everyone,

We’re still pretty new to Onshape so here goes…

We’ve now assembled our drive base and elevator and we’re about to detail design our arm for the Coral delivery onto the Reef. We’ve created a new Assembly to bring in our robot and the Reef structure to make some measurements.

Our goal is to make a rough sketch of an arm on a section view of the robot parked right beside Reef Structure, but it looks like Onshape doesn’t allow you to make a sketch on-the-fly in Assembly view. It appears to be a ‘Derive’ function in Part Studio where you can bring in assemblies, such as the Reef, but it looks like I can only grab individual parts only.

Any suggestions for a direction before I plunge deeper?

Thanks in advance.

cad.onshape.com

Modeling In-Context

Enables the user to select and edit a part in Part Studio in context to the other parts in the Assembly. Unselected parts cannot be edited in the Part Studio and appear transparent.

mentorsiggy:

It appears to be a ‘Derive’ function in Part Studio where you can bring in assemblies, such as the Reef, but it looks like I can only grab individual parts only.

you can also create a mastersketch and derive it into sub documents.

for example, here is our mastersketch:

master464×711 67.1 KB

for our elevator, we derive the crucial sketches (base sketch, max position sketch, side-view sketch) into a seperate document with our elevator.
elevator336×598 47.6 KB

this workflow allows you to design multiple mechanisms in tandem, and also makes your cad more parametric in the long run (by viewing mechanisms in relation to each other).

here is our master file and elevator file, you can explore how this works. you can also look at 6328’s 2024 robot cad, they have phenomenal practices.
